medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced presyncope that became recurrent. A year prior, he underwent surgical myectomy for hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy (HOCM), which had resulted in persistent class IIâ€“III dyspnoea and presyncope on medical therapy. Following surgery, he reported progressive exertional dyspnoea and orthostatic presyncope six months later. Electrocardiogram noted a new left bundle branch block.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of surgical myectomy for HOCM, renal transplant for end-stage renal failure secondary to reflux nephropathy, hypertension, and dyslipidaemia.
